ayas.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
The sure calamity!
What is the sure calamity!
And what would make you realize what the sure calamity is!
Samood and Ad called the striking calamity a lie.
Then as to Samood, they were destroyed by an excessively severe punishment.

ayas.arabic: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ
ayas.translation: And as to Ad, they were destroyed by a roaring, violent blast.

ayas.arabic: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَـٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى ٱلْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ
ayas.translation: Which He made to prevail against them for seven nights and eight days unremittingly, so that you might have seen the people therein prostrate as if they were the trunks of hollow palms.
ayas.transliteration: sakhharahā `alayhim sab`a layālin wathamāniyata ayyāmin ḥusūman fataral qawma fīhā ṣar`ā ka-annahum a`jāzu nakhlin khāwiyah

ayas.translation: Do you then see of them one remaining?

ayas.arabic: وَجَآءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُۥ وَٱلْمُؤْتَفِكَـٰتُ بِٱلْخَاطِئَةِ
ayas.translation: And Firon and those before him and the overthrown cities continuously committed sins.
ayas.transliteration: wajā-a fir`awnu wa man qablahu wal mu-tafikātu bil khāṭi-ah

ayas.arabic: فَعَصَوْا۟ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَّابِيَةً
ayas.translation: And they disobeyed the Apostle of their Lord, so He punished them with a vehement punishment.
ayas.transliteration: fa`aṣaw rasūla rabbihim fa-akhadhahum akhdhatan rābiyah

ayas.arabic: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلْمَآءُ حَمَلْنَـٰكُمْ فِى ٱلْجَارِيَةِ
ayas.translation: Surely We bore you up in the ship when the water rose high,
ayas.transliteration: innā lammā ṭaghal mā-u ḥamalnākum fil jāriyah

ayas.arabic: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٌ وَٰعِيَةٌ
ayas.translation: So that We may make it a reminder to you, and that the retaining ear might retain it.
ayas.transliteration: linaj`alahā lakum tadhkiratan wata`iyahā udhunun wā`iyah

ayas.arabic: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ
ayas.translation: And when the trumpet is blown with a single blast,
ayas.transliteration: fa-idhā nufikha fiṣ ṣūri nafkhatun wāḥidah

ayas.arabic: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَٰحِدَةً
ayas.translation: And the earth and the mountains are borne away and crushed with a single crushing.
ayas.transliteration: waḥumilatil-arḍu wal jibālu fadukkatā dakkatan wāḥidah

ayas.translation: On that day shall the great event come to pass,
And the heaven shall cleave asunder, so that on that day it shall be frail,

ayas.arabic: وَٱلْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرْجَآئِهَا ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَـٰنِيَةٌ
ayas.translation: And the angels shall be on the sides thereof; and above them eight shall bear on that day your Lord's power.
ayas.transliteration: wal malaku `alā arjā-ihā ۚ wayaḥmilu `arsha rabbika fawqahum yawma-idhin thamāniyah

ayas.arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ
ayas.translation: On that day you shall be exposed to view-- no secret of yours shall remain hidden.
ayas.transliteration: yawma-idhin tu`raḍūna lā takhfā minkum khāfiyah

ayas.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقْرَءُوا۟ كِتَـٰبِيَهْ
ayas.translation: Then as for him who is given his book in his right hand, he will say: Lo! read my book:
ayas.transliteration: fa-ammā man ūtiya kitābahu biyamīnihi fayaqūlu hā-umuq-ra-ū kitābiyah

ayas.translation: Surely I knew that I shall meet my account.
So he shall be in a life of pleasure,
In a lofty garden,
The fruits of which are near at hand:

ayas.arabic: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَآ أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَيَّامِ ٱلْخَالِيَةِ
ayas.translation: Eat and drink pleasantly for what you did beforehand in the days gone by.
ayas.transliteration: kulū washrabū hanī-an bimā aslaftum fil-ayyāmil khāliyah

ayas.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَـٰبِيَهْ
ayas.translation: And as for him who is given his book in his left hand he shall say: O would that my book had never been given me:
ayas.transliteration: wa-ammā man ūtiya kitābahu bishimālihi fayaqūlu yālaytanī lam ūta kitābiyah

ayas.translation: And I had not known what my account was:
O would that it had made an end (of me):
My wealth has availed me nothing:
My authority is gone away from me.
Lay hold on him, then put a chain on him,
Then cast him into the burning fire,

ayas.arabic: ثُمَّ فِى سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَٱسْلُكُوهُ
ayas.translation: Then thrust him into a chain the length of which is seventy cubits.
ayas.transliteration: thumma fī silsilatin dhar`uhā sab`ūna dhirā`an faslukūh

ayas.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
ayas.translation: Surely he did not believe in Allah, the Great,
Nor did he urge the feeding of the poor.
Therefore he has not here today a true friend,
Nor any food except refuse,
Which none but the wrongdoers eat.
But nay! I swear by that which you see,
And that which you do not see.
Most surely, it is the Word brought by an honored Apostle,

ayas.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ
ayas.translation: And it is not the word of a poet; little is it that you believe;
ayas.transliteration: wa mā huwa biqawli shā`ir ۚ qalīlan mā tu-minūn

ayas.arabic: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
ayas.translation: Nor the word of a soothsayer; little is it that you mind.
ayas.transliteration: walā biqawli kāhin ۚ qalīlan mā tadhakkarūn

ayas.translation: It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
And if he had fabricated against Us some of the sayings,
We would certainly have seized him by the right hand,
Then We would certainly have cut off his aorta.

ayas.arabic: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَـٰجِزِينَ
ayas.translation: And not one of you could have withheld Us from him.
And most surely it is a reminder for those who guard (against evil).
And most surely We know that some of you are rejecters.
ayas.transliteration: wa innā lana`lamu anna minkum mukadhhibīn

ayas.translation: And most surely it is a great grief to the unbelievers.
And most surely it is the true certainty
Therefore-glorify the name of your Lord, the Great.
